content: Yes, there are penalties and fines for individuals and businesses that do not adhere to low-emission policies in São Paulo. The city has implemented an environmental inspection program that enforces regulations related to vehicle emissions, industrial pollution, and other sources of air pollution. Fines may be imposed on individuals and businesses that violate these regulations, ranging from fines, suspension of licenses, or even criminal charges. Additionally, the government has implemented incentives that encourage individuals and businesses to switch to low-emission vehicles and adopt environmentally-friendly practices, such as tax exemptions and subsidies for electric and hybrid vehicles.
